messages.subject: Re: Any NYC-area unschoolers?
messages.msgSnippet: I m a long ago CU (GS & SIPA) graduate in the NY Capital Region, but I go into NYC fairly frequently.  I started homeschooling this year with a comprehensive
messages.messageBody:
I'm a long ago CU (GS & SIPA) graduate in the NY Capital Region, but I
go into NYC fairly frequently. I started homeschooling this year with a
comprehensive plan, but I'm slowly evolving into unschooling.

I'm sharing what I learn about homeschooling, parenting, scouting, and
child advocacy on www.onlivingbylearning.blogspot.com
<http://www.onlivingbylearning.blogspot.com> . I would be happy to
speak to you. My email is onthelongroad@...
<mailto:onthelongroad@...>

Good luck in your research, Sandra




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Any NYC-area unschoolers?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, I m a grad student at Columbia writing about unschooling for my master s thesis. Some of you may have seen my posts on other Yahoo groups. I m looking to
messages.messageBody:
Hi, I'm a grad student at Columbia writing about unschooling for my
master's thesis. Some of you may have seen my posts on other Yahoo groups.

I'm looking to talk to some New York City-area families who are either
considering unschooling, or committed but new to it. If anyone lives
in the area and would like to talk, that would be great.

You can e-mail me at kjb2141@.... Looking forward to speaking
with you.


Sincerely,

Kaitlin Bell
